title: Flipped Learning-Based Mathematics Instructional Design for Pre-Service Special Education Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental special education theories and elementary mathematics teaching experience
context.additional_context: Development of flipped learning-based math education strategies for in-service elementary special education teachers in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Prospective special education teachers demonstrate a 30% improvement in designing math lessons applying behavioral principles (e.g., reinforcement, prompting, extinction) in a flipped learning environment.

Learners develop three or more customized instructional strategies tailored to the mathematical concept comprehension levels of students with special needs, utilizing smartphone-based video materials and PBL assignments.
Participants achieve an execution accuracy of 85% or higher in evidence-based practices for special education mathematics instruction through peer feedback and collaborative learning.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
